title: Man City chairman recalls turning point in Pep Guardiola's Premier League career
text:

Manchester City chairman Khaldoon Al Mubarak remembers the exact moment when Pep Guardiola's reign went from frustration to domination.

Guardiola joined City in the summer of 2016 with a reputation as one of the greatest managers in the game, having won a host of titles with Barcelona and then Bayern Munich.

He won his first 10 competitive matches in charge of the club - but then ended his first season trophyless as City capitulated in the title race and Leicester City stunned football by capturing the Premier League crown.

And Guardiola was feeling the frustration early the following season after a 1-1 draw with Everton at the Etihad Stadium.

City had dominated but had been unable to make their superiority count - a failing familiar from the previous campaign.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Guardiola locked himself in his office, but a knock on the door and a message of support proved just what the City boss needed - and it inspired a record run of 18 straight Premier League victories that would go a huge way towards securing the title that season.

The knock came from City chairman Khaldoon Al Mubarak, who told Guardiola: “You’re our man. There’s no one else. Don’t worry.”

Khaldoon recalls that moment in a new book, ‘Pep’s City — the Making of a Superteam’.

“That evening was a tense and difficult moment but it would spawn thousands of wonderful ones," Khaldoon says in the book, according to The Sun .

(Image: PA Wire)

“When you set out to do something so difficult and ambitious, the joy and stress go hand in hand.”

City went on win five of the next six domestic trophies available, claiming the League Cup that season before wrapping up the title in April 2018, then completing an unprecedented league, FA Cup and League Cup treble last season.

And City's director of football Txiki Begiristain knows that moment on a tense and anxious day was crucial.

He said: “It was the way Khaldoon talked to him that night, he showed how much confidence he had in us.

(Image: The FA Collection)

“It had been a dreadful day. We’d been the better team but hadn’t got the result and everyone was feeling a little bit shaken.

“Khaldoon told Pep that he knew it wasn’t easy, but he had complete faith in what he was doing.

“He said that in his eyes there was no other way for the club to proceed. Only his way — the Guardiola way.

“Was it what Pep needed to hear? Of course. But he said it with such conviction and Pep believed him.”
description: After a frustrating season, one 'Pep talk' inspired a record run of 18 matches and two campaigns of dominance
